textBox.richText: Member of the biometric team from April 2010 to --. Scientific collaborator and PostDoc on face anti-spoofing. Involved in the project Replay, TABULA RASA, BEAT, COHFACE and TeSLA. André Anjos started studying electronics and computers in 1994, when he joined the Electronics Engineering School (http://www.del.ufrj.br) at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (http://www.ufrj.br). He obtained a Ph.D. in Signal Processing in 2006 with a work on High-Energy Physics Particle Detection using Neural Networks. In 2004, he joins CERN (http://www.cern.ch), Switzerland to work on the development and construction of the Trigger and Data Acquisition systems of the ATLAS Experiment. His domains of interest are pattern recognition and applied computing. You can follow this link to André's homepage (http://andreanjos.org) for more information, his CV and a complete list of publications.
